description:
## Theory
Right now we know how to declare subjects and data properties. The next step is object properties.

The difference between object and data property declaration is just the content of the objectMap. In object properties, **rr:template** is used instead of the **rml:reference**, **rr:termType** and **rr:datatype** seen in the previous tutorial. The **rr:template** in an objectMap follows the same syntax as in a subjectMap (using a string that contains static information and may have data coming from the data source).
## Hands-on
### Task
Fill the mapping below with the object property ***rdfs:seeAlso***. This property will use the URI **"http://dbpedia.org/resource/"** and the column City.
### CSV file content
ID,Name,Phone,City
1,"Lily Dickens",585-610-2352,Oneonta
2,"Chadd Sporer",+1-352-334-0992,Iowa
3,"Katharina Kuvalis",(272) 642-0684,Alberta
4,"Wilhelmine Johns III",574.747.4829,Bock
5,"Sofia Rowe",+15204328362,Elmhurst
<!---
Replace table when Markdown works properly
| ID | Name | Phone | City |
|--|--|--|--|
| 1 | "Lily Dickens" | 585-610-2352 | Oneonta |
| 2 | "Chadd Sporer" | +1-352-334-0992 | Iowa |
| 3 | "Katharina Kuvalis" | (272) 642-0684 | Alberta |
| 4 | "Wilhelmine Johns III" | 574.747.4829 | Bock |
| 5 | "Sofia Rowe" | +15204328362 | Elmhurst |
--->
expected_result:
